uk.co.dancowan.robots.hal.core
Interface Command

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCommand, SendString
public interface Command

Interface for an SRV1 command.

Author:
Dan Cowan

Method Detail

addListener

void addListener(CommandListener listener)
Adds this listener to the collection of listeners notified about CommandEvent instances.

Parameters:
listener - CommandListener
See Also:
CommandEvent

removeListener

void removeListener(CommandListener listener)
Removes this listener from the collection of listeners notified about CommandEvent instances.

Parameters:
listener - CommandListener
See Also:
CommandEvent

interrupt

boolean interrupt()
Called to request that this command stop execution at the first possible opportunity and return control to the SRV1 instance.

Returns:
true iff this command can be (and was) interrupted

resume

void resume()
Requests this command resume polling.

Commands exit their read write thread when interrupted so this method will do nothing for volatile commands and serves only to enable commands run in a polling queue which have been interrupted.

execute

void execute(CommandQ que)
Called by the SRV instance to request this command to perform its action.

Parameters:
SRV - the SRV instance

failed

void failed(java.lang.String reason)
Call-back to notify of external failure.

Command instances should stop executing as soon as possible and tidy any resources.

Parameters:
reason - String, the reason for the failure

getPriority

int getPriority()
Returns the priority of this command.

Priority should be a positive integer, larger values indicate a lower priority. Long running processes should normally be a low priority and enable cancellation.

Default priority is 100, long running commands such as image polling should be 1000.

Returns:
int, the priority

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Return this commands name.

Commands are often named to look like methods: 

    getImage()
    motors()
Key parameters are often appended: 
    motors() 100 100 200

Returns:
String, the command's name
